page.title: 01An Introduction to Durris
page.content: Our block is situated in the hills above the Dee Valley, about thirteen miles west of the city of Aberdeen in North East Scotland. It is an area of low hills,farmland and forests,with the River Dee flowing west to east through the block. There are no villages or towns,just one or two small hamlets and two recently built housing developments near the primary school,as well as scattered older cottages and farms.Employment is generally in farming or forestry, although most people now commute into Aberdeen and many work in oil related industry.The people enjoy the country landscape with its fine views and wildlife,but there are few amenities and no shops,and so for everything they need, people must travel by car to the nearby towns.
